Module com.sudoku
Package com.sudoku.model

Class SudokuGenerator

java.lang.Object
com.sudoku.model.SudokuGenerator
public class SudokuGenerator extends Object
Important clarification: This class was created with AI (the only one generated entirely by AI). The main idea is to create a solved sudoku and be able to obtain the numbers of the sections. Generates a fully solved 6x6 Sudoku board using a backtracking algorithm.

Each Sudoku follows the 6×6 grid layout with 6 blocks (2×3 each):

  • Block layout: 3 rows × 2 columns of blocks.
  • Each block contains 2 rows and 3 columns of cells.
The generator can also return the numbers from a specific block (1–6).

Block numbering layout:

 +---------+---------+
 | Block 1 | Block 2 |
 +---------+---------+
 | Block 3 | Block 4 |
 +---------+---------+
 | Block 5 | Block 6 |
 +---------+---------+
Example usage: 
     SudokuGenerator generator = new SudokuGenerator();
     generator.printSudoku();
     List<Integer> section1 = generator.getSection(1);

  • Method Details

    • getSection

      public List<Integer> getSection(int sectionNumber)
      Returns the list of numbers contained in one of the six 2×3 Sudoku blocks.

      The Sudoku has 3 rows × 2 columns of blocks.

      Mapping of block numbers:

      • Section 1 → (0,0)
      • Section 2 → (0,1)
      • Section 3 → (1,0)
      • Section 4 → (1,1)
      • Section 5 → (2,0)
      • Section 6 → (2,1)
      Parameters:
      sectionNumber - the section index (1–6)
      Returns:
      list of integers (the six values in that section)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if sectionNumber is not between 1 and 6

    • printSudoku

      public void printSudoku()
      Prints the complete Sudoku grid in a formatted way. Useful for debugging or visualization in console output.
